It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous areas with rich, well-drained soil. This species is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique appearance.

It is adapted to the cool and dry climate of its native range. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its region.
